page.title: 20WILDLIFE
page.content: There is lots of wildlife in the area. Many wild birds come to the school bird tables to be fed in winter and there are many pheasants in the surrounding fields. Hares and rabbits are often seen too and often eat flowers and vegetables growing in the gardens. There ars small muntjac deer and also many fallow deer mainly in small groups but sometimes in a large herd.These fallow deer raid gardens too even when they are gaurded by an electric fence. They are not often seen close to but sometimes their footprints can be seen in the snow very close to the houses. They are particularly fond on windfall apples in autumn.
